listitem.para: #define GLM_MAT3_IDENTITY_INIT
#define GLM_MAT3_ZERO_INIT
#define GLM_MAT3_IDENTITY ((mat3)GLM_MAT3_IDENTITY_INIT)
#define GLM_MAT3_ZERO ((mat3)GLM_MAT3_ZERO_INIT)
#define glm_mat3_dup(mat, dest) glm_mat3_copy(mat, dest)
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat3_copy (mat3 mat, mat3 dest)
copy all members of [mat] to [dest]
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat3_identity (mat3 mat)
make given matrix identity. It is identical with below, but it is more easy to do that with this func especially for members e.g. glm_mat3_identity(aStruct->aMatrix);
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat3_identity_array (mat3 *__restrict mat, size_t count)
make given matrix array's each element identity matrix
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat3_zero (mat3 mat)
make given matrix zero.
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat3_mul (mat3 m1, mat3 m2, mat3 dest)
multiply m1 and m2 to dest
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat3_transpose_to (mat3 m, mat3 dest)
transpose mat3 and store in dest
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat3_transpose (mat3 m)
tranpose mat3 and store result in same matrix
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat3_mulv (mat3 m, vec3 v, vec3 dest)
multiply mat3 with vec3 (column vector) and store in dest vector
CGLM_INLINE float glm_mat3_trace (mat3 m)
trace of matrix
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat3_quat (mat3 m, versor dest)
convert mat3 to quaternion
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat3_scale (mat3 m, float s)
scale (multiply with scalar) matrix
CGLM_INLINE float glm_mat3_det (mat3 mat)
mat3 determinant
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat3_inv (mat3 mat, mat3 dest)
inverse mat3 and store in dest
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat3_swap_col (mat3 mat, int col1, int col2)
swap two matrix columns
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat3_swap_row (mat3 mat, int row1, int row2)
swap two matrix rows
CGLM_INLINE float glm_mat3_rmc (vec3 r, mat3 m, vec3 c)
helper for R (row vector) * M (matrix) * C (column vector)

section.title: glm_mat3_mul()

para.computeroutput: CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat3_mul (mat3 m1, mat3 m2, mat3 dest)

para.para: multiply m1 and m2 to dest

section.para: m1, m2 and dest matrices can be same matrix, it is possible to write this:

literallayout.computeroutput: mat3 m = GLM_MAT3_IDENTITY_INIT; glm_mat3_mul(m, m, m);

section.title: glm_mat3_rmc()

para.computeroutput: CGLM_INLINE float glm_mat3_rmc (vec3 r, mat3 m, vec3 c)

para.para: helper for R (row vector) * M (matrix) * C (column vector)

section.para: rmc stands for Row * Matrix * Column
the result is scalar because R * M = Matrix1x3 (row vector), then Matrix1x3 * Vec3 (column vector) = Matrix1x1 (Scalar)
